page.title: 13FARMING
page.content: A LARGE AND A SMALL FARM One of the larger farms in the area is some310 acres,with some100 British Friesian cows. Home grown silage,hay and bought in concentrates are fed to the dairy cows in winter.Calving is all year round and the farm has a Charolais and Hereford bull. 100 hens are also kept to augment the income, after the introduction of EEC milk quotas. In comparison a smaller farm in the area owns 20 acres and rents 15 acres.It has 20 milking cows and followe and boith buys and breeds herd replacements.A yield of 4,500 litres of milk per cow per year is expected and all feed is home grown, although it is not always possible each year to achieve this.Concentrates are bought in. 16 turkeys are fattened each year.
